p: Pumping rates will additionally interfere in this dynamic scheme. As mentioned, capture zones affecting stream reaches and wetlands may progressively dry them up. Recovered natural flow fields after the irrigation season feed groundwater-dependent stream reaches and wetlands again, as in the Baix Ter and Baix Fluvi√† areas (Mas-Pla et al. 1999). This is the reason why, especially in wetlands and ponds, preserving the natural habitat in their shores, where nitrogen assimilation/immobilization processes occur, is so essential.
